description: Lysine acetylation is one of the most prevalent post-translational modifications and has since been found to regulate histone functions and affect chromatin structure and gene expression. Here, we charactered Rpd3, a histone deacetylase of Beauveria bassiana, played important roles in the deacetylation of histone H3 and H4. We unveil the role of Rpd3 in asexual development and show that a ΔRpd3 mutant strain has severe growth defects and is defective in conidiophores and blastospores development. Acetylomic analyses indicated that Rpd3 functions in asexual development and virulence and multiple stress responses via broad genetic pathways in B. bassiana. Therefore, we conclude that BbRpd3 is vital for asexual development, virulence and multiple stress responses in Beauveria bassiana.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Beauveria bassiana, rpd3, sir2, acetylome, LC-MS/MS.

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Cai Q, Wang ZK, Shao W, Ying SH, Feng MG. Essential role of Rpd3-dependent lysine modification in the growth, development and virulence of Beauveria bassiana. Environ Microbiol. 2018 20(4):1590-1606

title: Quantitative analysis of acetylome reveals the roles of Rpd3 and Sir2 in asexual development, virulence and multiple stress responses in Beauveria bassiana.
